node.title: Public school teachers in NSW are striking tomorrow — here's everything you need to know
node.description: Teachers will join thousands of other public servants taking industrial action tomorrow and parents are being warned to make alternative care plans for the day.
node.content:
["NSW's\u00a0public school teachers and principals are walking off the job tomorrow,\u00a0the first time in a decade such statewide industrial action has been taken.\u00a0", "The Teachers Federation Council has apologised for\u00a0the disruption to families \u2014 but says it has no choice after trying to negotiate with the NSW government for the last 18 months.", "Here's what you need to know.", "
Why are teachers striking?
", "", "
Teachers voted unanimously to stop work on Tuesday over unsustainable\u00a0workloads and uncompetitive\u00a0salaries.(Supplied: Teachers Federation)
", "The key reasons given for the strike include\u00a0a 2.5 per cent salary cap that's been in place for 10\u00a0years and\u00a0chronic teacher shortages.", "In line with the recommendations of the\u202findependent\u202fGallop inquiry, teachers and principals are seeking a salary increase of between 5 and\u00a07.5 per cent a year.", "Teachers Federation president Angelo Gavrielatos said staff shortages were creating unsustainable workloads.", "\"In fact since June the teacher\u00a0shortage\u00a0has doubled in our schools, [there are] 2,000 vacancies today from Bondi to Broken Hill and these shortages will grow over the course of the next number of years,\" he said.", "The teachers union points to\u00a0a report from the Education Department warning the government that\u00a0NSW public schools would run out of teachers in the next five years.", "Internal briefings show the state needs another 11,000 teachers over the next 10 years because of a baby boom.", "At the same time there's been a\u00a030 per cent drop\u00a0in young people entering initial teacher education and a 50 per cent drop out rate.", "The Federation's claims about staff shortages\u00a0has been disputed by the NSW Education Department.", "It said\u00a0the vacancy rate in NSW for teachers was at a low level for an organisation of its\u00a0size.", "\"A vacancy in a school is covered by a casual or temporary teacher and does not mean a class is without a teacher,\" the Department said in a statement.", "
What do I do with my kids tomorrow?
", "", "
Teachers say more resignations are inevitable due to the pressures of the job.(ABC News)
", "Unions NSW said individual schools and principals would decide whether there were enough skeleton staff to supervise children.", "Parents are advised to make other arrangements for their children as classes will be cancelled.", "However, parents can also contact their\u00a0school\u00a0to find out if childcare is available.", "But the Education Department said the majority of schools across the state would\u00a0remain open with supervision for students.", "Parents had\u00a0been informed where schools would be closed and those students would\u00a0have access to learning from home material.", "Education Secretary Georgina Harrisson said she understood the frustration of families and the industrial action capped off a difficult year for many parents and carers.", "\"I want to reassure parents that we are doing all we can to ensure learning continues without disruption \u2014 especially given the challenges students, teachers and families have experienced this year,\" Ms Harrisson said.", "
What is the deadline\u00a0for negotiations?
", "The NSW Supreme Court has been asked to consider whether the strike can be averted.", "The Education Department has called on\u00a0teachers to comply with the Industrial Relations Commission's (IRC) order and not strike.", "\"The Department is still negotiating with the Federation on their claims and the place for this is in the IRC,\"\u00a0Ms Harrisson said.", "The action\u00a0comes after 18 months of negotiations over a pay deal,\u00a0and\u00a0the Education Minister Sarah Mitchell said\u00a0it was disappointing to see teachers\u00a0going ahead with the strike\u00a0while talks were underway.", "\"Despite the ruling of the Industrial Relations Commission [IRC] that the action not take place ... the Federation seem hell bent on this disruption,\" she said.", "\"I think for our kids it's been a hard enough year for them already, we need to have them in the classroom each and every day.\"", "Premier Dominic Perrottet has previously said\u00a0that the government's position remains that public servants in NSW get a 2.5 per cent pay increase.", "\"Ultimately this is a matter that will be brought to the Industrial Relations Commission \u2014\u00a0that's where it will be resolved,\" Mr Perrottet said.", "
When did teachers last strike?
", "", "
Thousands of\u00a0public service workers rallied\u00a0against\u00a0a\u00a02.5 per cent wage cap in September 2011.(AAP: Tracey Nearmy)
", "The last time teachers held a mass walkout in NSW, thousands protested outside state parliament in 2011 over a 2.5 per cent cap on\u00a0public sector pay rises.", "They were joined by\u00a0nurses, firefighters and police in that strike, which was also deemed\u00a0illegal by the\u00a0New South Wales Industrial Relations Commission.", "The commission fined\u00a0the state's teachers union $6,000."]
